{"id":1052270924,"question_id":3081,"lang":"java","lang_name":"Java","time":"8 months, 4 weeks","timestamp":1695006982,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"44 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/1052270924/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Minimum Array Length After Pair Removals","memory":"60.8 MB","code":"class Solution {\n    public int minLengthAfterRemovals(List<Integer> nums) {\n        HashMap<Integer , Integer> map = new HashMap<>();\n        \n        \n        int max = 0;\n        for(int n: nums){\n            map.put(n, map.getOrDefault(n, 0)+1);\n            max = Math.max(max, map.get(n));\n        }\n        \n        if(max > nums.size()/2){\n            return max - (nums.size()-max);\n        }else \n            return nums.size()%2;\n        \n    }\n}","compare_result":"","title_slug":"minimum-array-length-after-pair-removals","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
